revised_title: Investigating Feeble Currents Generated by Physical Action and Oxidation of Metals under Voltaic Influences
tldr: The authors study the development of feeble currents using aeration plates and observe that the efficiency of the air film on one plate is depreciated while the other's efficiency is exalted. They also discover that larger amounts of current are generated when using silver plates, as the oxygen liberated attacks the metal, causing partial dissolution.
